website_summaries.verdict: Monopod that also includes a removable tripod base for ultimate in versatility. Offers many extra features.
pros: Works with nearly any type of camera
Mounting plate can support up to 11 lbs
Monopod extends to up to 70" in length
Includes quick release plate and bubble level, which are great features for photographers to have available
cons: Tripod legs consist of low quality materials
Plastic locking collars may wear out

customer_reviews.title: Great monopod check out the video
customer_reviews.text: Great monopod check out the video. Yes it will hold a DSLR with lens. For some of the longer lenses it may not work
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome monopod. Smooth tilt and panning. Easy to manipulate quickly for great shots. I love the quick release camera attachment. Camera snaps right back in without touching the release lever. I love it. I use a Canon DSLR rebel T5i
customer_reviews.author: pappysproductions

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last long
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in August of 2018 (its May of 2019) and only have used it 4 times. I am not a photographer I use it to hold a small go pro session for time lapse. I tried using this weekend and noticed it wasn't standing right. After looking at it I noticed all 3 legs were broke. The metal is very cheap. Not sure how everyone else's is holding up but mine is dead. It was nice when it worked. And because it didn't break early enough I can't return this.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan Santos

customer_reviews.title: Best monopod
customer_reviews.text: Love this monopod. It's very sturdy, when my 100-400 or 150-600 lens is mounted there is no shake. I never leave unattended but with those heavy lens a lightweight tripod even will have shake. So I have been very pleased. I love that it has a carrying case too! It arrived in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: D. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was going to be great, turned out not to be.
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't nearly as good as I thought it was going to be. Used it on a shoot and quickly noticed that the fluid head couldn't even support the Sony A7S II I was using with a basic prime on it. I switched my own fluid head onto this which worked better. Also starting to have a problem with the feet. One won't lock into place in the folded up position. The sections also slip down so be careful if shooting video with this.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin

customer_reviews.title: I think that this may the perfect monopod.
customer_reviews.text: I think that this may the perfect monopod...it provides for a lot of versatility when it comes to shooting different events and types of photography. It is very stable when using the included legs. I use my ball-head occasionally and it is very balanced even with my DSLR and battery grip.
customer_reviews.author: Gentle Man

customer_reviews.title: no mounting plate included
customer_reviews.text: appeared to be well constructed BUT camera mounting plate was NOT included and my tripod plate did not fit. customer service failed to respond quickly so I returned it. dumb to not include an inexpensive camera mount in the package as the product appears to require an uncommon mount. the mount assembly did not look secure but impossible to fairly judge unless a camera is mounted. of course, being Chinese, no instructions are provided.
customer_reviews.author: dave22q

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to set the height and if needed
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built and very clever supportive device. It is easy to set the height and if needed, the supporting feet can be folded down and provide a stable base. My concern is that the only part on this device-the quick release plate that attaches to the camera, cannot be replaced from the seller. These plates are susceptible to being lost or additional one need for a second camera. It appears each monopod or tripod has their own proprietary design and the plates are not interchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: jriorda

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, very sturdy and I feel safe with my camera on it. The quick release can be a little difficult to use but once I figured out the best way to clip my camera in and out it works fine, just a little scratched up now. It is pretty heavy and my arm sure gets a work out while using it but I wouldn't want a light one because it wouldn't be as sturdy. I love being able to have stand up on its own, helps me so I don't have to hold my camera the whole time and keeps it nice and steady! Would recommend this to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Brielle Hunt

customer_reviews.title: DIGIANT DOESN’T HONOR WARRANTY
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this monopod primarily for wedding videography. When I first received it I loved it! It felt sturdy even with my 5D Mark IV on it. Initially I noticed a few “annoyances” which were easy to look over. For example whenever I would twist from left to right while panning it would loosen the middle mount (just below where it pans). After 2 shoots one of the legs broke off. I hadn’t done much of anything with it in that timeframe so I contacted the company twice hoping to resolve the issue with their warranty, and NEVER got a response. I decided I would resort to leaving a review in hopes of getting a response from them.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: weird
customer_reviews.text: after installing the go pro on top of this stand, you can see a large black object in the center of the 360 photo. thats because you can the round black piece directly underneath of the camera. this is a really weird placing on the manufacturer........... the product seems fancy and professional.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W & Gisselle

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Comman
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a good quality monopod then get this over the Comman. More expensive is not always better. I bought the comman (carbon fiber at that) and quickly returned it. This Digiant has a wider base for greater sturdiness and security. It is much more plasticky feeling than other monopods that I've tried, but it's still a pretty good value. If this were a little less expensive then it would be a greater value. Overall it's better then a lot of the competition out there which makes it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MindcontrolTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty monopod
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty monopod, a little heavy, but its the first one that survived a few months of usage. so I would definitely recommend it to anybody interested out there. there are some tricks to use it with a 360 camera, let me know if you want details :) update 15 months after purchase: Still working like a charm. Best thing is you can take it into the place with your backpack and it fits. just have to unscrew the base. that can happen in 2 seconds. Still a very happy customer..
customer_reviews.author: geogeo

customer_reviews.title: Problems right from day one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monopod a little over a month ago and have used it a total of 5 days. As soon as I received it one of the legs didn't lock in when it was extended which made the tripod base useless. This weekend the zipper on the case busted making the case just about useless. If I had to buy this again I think I would look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Lewis

customer_reviews.title: would however recommend getting a different tripod head as the one included ...
customer_reviews.text: MUCH sturdier than I anticipated it being, especially given the cost. Heavy and very solid base, would however recommend getting a different tripod head as the one included is lackluster.
customer_reviews.author: Magelen

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Monopod - Emphasis on HEAVY!
customer_reviews.text: This mono pod has some weight to it! Right out of the box it was very easy to see that it is very well built - made to last through some wear & tear. It is very easy to use and perfectly mounts to my Sony A6000. It is very nice for getting a stable platform for shooting. It comes with a good carrying case as well. I'm very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great solid well made monopod with flip out feet.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, solid monopod with 3 easy flip out feet so it can stand alone for static filiming. Easy to hold as it has a good grip handle. The expandable feet section can actually unscrew as they show in the photo so it can be used as true monopod. The head turns nicely for easy swivel. It's a great inexpensive solution for mobile filming.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my sister and she loved it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister and she loves it! She is a professional content creator and needed something lightweight to shoot with. I got this for her for Christmas and she shot all our photos with it and was very pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lexington Chang

customer_reviews.title: a beast but works great
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize how big this thing is but did want the height which it has. The panning however is too tight. Overall though, am pleased and seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: LinnDor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and very user friendly. A must have monopod.
customer_reviews.text: This Monopod is FANTASTIC! Very durable, sturdy and well made. I am impressed especially with how easy the camera clip-in and release is made. I would recommend this product to anyone. I searched many Monopods and decided on this one. Glad I did! I also really enjoy the classy bag that came with it as well, which was a surprise.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Held up good as a tripod
customer_reviews.text: Used it once in a studio. Held up good as a tripod. Pans well. But hard to transport if you're going on simple day trips, since it doesn't fold to a standard 20" height. Can't just strap it to my camera back pack. Returning this for a more portable one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly for Video Shoot!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a video shoot and it worked amazingly well. No complaints. I used it to hold my DSLR and shotgun microphone and it worked perfectly. I haven't owned it long so I hope it holds up well, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Solved a host of problems.
customer_reviews.text: I need to move my video camera quickly to various views sometimes among milling fans crowding around my subjects. This allows me to do this while creating a stable video.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kreider

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy stand
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I'm doing makeup, I attach my ring light to it as it can be raised up or down. Plus it's super sturdy and can handle the weight of the light.
customer_reviews.author: Jamiec3

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and solid
customer_reviews.text: So glad i bought this mono pod that can also be used as a tripod or for a nice stabilized video. The build is sold metal and hinges with no wobbles after almost a year of use. Wish i would have bough sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Nas Djoev

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to tighten --- Loosens up upon use. The fold out legs don't really to stablize the Monopod. Worked ok on Pavement, but grass and sand/beach not so well. I am looking for a more basic monopod.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Kellaher

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and flexible tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Got this item and immediately loved the lightweight and flexibility of this product. Best part is when I travel it doesn't require room like my other tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo H.

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod. I use it with a Mevo camera ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tripod. I use it with a Mevo camera at trade shows. Easy to set up and put away. Does everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Too big for travel use
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty hefty and not very good for travel. I was hoping it would be much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Fame

customer_reviews.title: Great Flexibility I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it so much I got 2 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie M.

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Just got this, but my first impression is - WOW - this thing is sturdy and big. It may be a bit bulky for some, but it is exactly what I was hoping for!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G

customer_reviews.title: SMOOTH
customer_reviews.text: So the video I attached is with my G7. This camera is known for terrible autofocus and very poor unstabilized body and lenses. The video was very good and fluid. The monopod clearly is my new weapon in my arsenal of camera gear. The fluid head is nice and firm. Feels very sturdy. 8.5/10 - Does what it says and does it well. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Nodel

customer_reviews.title: Nice and steady for videos and snaps
customer_reviews.text: So far it has allowed me to make some steady videos and take close up snaps. I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good product.. Reliable product... One thing that I didn't like it is the oil which come inside pod... When I expand it on first use... All the rest are awesome...
customer_reviews.author: Glassman555

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best motopod I had ever triyed. I am so happy to use it in Food phatography
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Escobar Del Cid

customer_reviews.title: Smaller is better
customer_reviews.text: Much more compact than a tripod, but affords the same stability
customer_reviews.author: bruce e shollmier

customer_reviews.title: Works Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this on a few videography shoots and it’s rock solid ,holds my camcorders great (Sony AX53’s)
customer_reviews.author: T.Cole.

customer_reviews.title: Grade - A
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice product indeed, but a wee bit lighter duty than what I needed, but I will use it and am satisfied ....
customer_reviews.author: Brad A. Morey

customer_reviews.title: You need this.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tripod/monopod. It's very portable, very durable, and works just like manufacturers claim. It actually replaces the big, bulky tripods in many cases. Nice addition to my pile of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: James Mulcahy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and well made
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a versatile and well made monopod this is for you. I am a picky buyer and I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Longer than Me !
customer_reviews.text: Wow it is longer than me item as described and as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sandip Chaudhary

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Much heavier duty than I envisioned it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Much heavier duty than I envisioned it would be. And very easy to set up and tear down.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Encino

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this item came in so handy can't ...
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this item came in so handy can't say enough about it The feet come off so easily and is tall enough for me to use just love it
customer_reviews.author: Wonda E.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this compact tripod / monopod. It seems to be very well made with high quality materials. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Hard  to release legs
customer_reviews.text: Well made, love the quick disconnect,level bubble & leg length. I can NOT press the blue button for leg release. Great monopod just too heavy to carry on hikes & can't operate leg release. Pushed them on countertops & wouldn't release. I am extremely strong. Husband had a hard time too.
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Clunky,came with a fault.Was big and awkward and just super hard to set up since all elements were somewhat stuck.dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Keller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tripod for my purposes. It is sturdy, sleek, and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: William Truswell + Lynn Truswell

customer_reviews.title: Very Steady.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and very steady. I use it at the rifle range to hold my spotting scope. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Gun Hawgs

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not stable. Will not stand on its own with a camera attached. A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Vinson

customer_reviews.title: A Tank!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is amazing. It has all the bells and is really well built.
customer_reviews.author: Road Legal 4WD

customer_reviews.title: Have had this for a few months and happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for a few months and happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Tony Reece

customer_reviews.title: Is the build quality as good? No
customer_reviews.text: It does everything the Sirui or Manfrotto monopods do at half the price. Is the build quality as good? No. But it's decent and will get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Bigbuddha319

customer_reviews.title: Small foot print makes it easy to set up and not be in the way.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: breaks down small. Small footprint when set up. Easy to use. Con: little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shoemake

customer_reviews.title: Many features
customer_reviews.text: Have not had time to use at this point, but think the product will perform. Suggest a instruction sheet as to what each feature does.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold L Heubrock

customer_reviews.title: Love this mono/Tripod
customer_reviews.text: Love this mono/Tripod. It totally replaced my other Tripod. This is a great MonoPod. If you are thinking about buying it you DEFINITELY should.
customer_reviews.author: Ablaze Entertainment

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have yet to use this item, but it is exactly as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It is very steady when the legs are out and when they are in works great for video so I can move it a little but still be steady great monopod
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product - sturdier than expected and worked exactly as described
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Heitkamp III

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, then broke.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this when first purchased... then one leg broke. The metal snapped. Hoping replacement legs are available.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This a great 3-1 Pro monopod
customer_reviews.text: This a great 3-1 Pro monopod! It is really heavy! For those who look for a nice and strong monopod. Here it goes! But Extra effect to go outside and use it!
customer_reviews.author: Flávio Pessoa

customer_reviews.title: Solid monopod
customer_reviews.text: I liked the quality - it felt very solid. and it was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Trond-Erik Eide

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monopod. So great that it was stolen and I am about to order another.
customer_reviews.author: Dare

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 360° photo work. Sturdy even in a strong wind and easy to deploy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great monopod
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately returned mine. Although the build quality of this unit is very good, it was just heavier and larger than I anticipated. If you aren't looking for ultra-portability, this product rocks though.
customer_reviews.author: ConserviDoug

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this monopod. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Brightbill

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient..possible shake though
customer_reviews.text: The monopod has given me the ability to get drone-like footage with the XC10 mounted on an EC1 Gimble. There is vibration in some of the video though, so I will be working with it more to figure out if its a weakness in the pole or myself. With the monopod, gimble and camera, full extension can get pretty tiring pretty quick on your arm. Feels solid and we literally took it out of the box and started using it within minutes. Hoping for great things with this.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great monopad...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great monopod... very versatile...just be careful where you put it... if there is sand try to cover the mechanisms... to avoid get it stuck... I used it with a 360 camera... it works great...
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: The replacement product more than met and exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Originally the item came broken, but E&J has great customer service and they quickly sent out a replacement that is in excellent working order. This monopod is solid and has quickly replaced my tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Sean T.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy monopod
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. Best monopod I found in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: ChinkyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good Tripod for almost any occasion
customer_reviews.text: Good Tripod I like using it more and more than the others. Was unsure off the design but now I see that it's an all around tripod to carry out the door.
customer_reviews.author: SD Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this item. It is heavier than a traditional tripod but worth it for me. I've been using mine for several months now and I love this item!
customer_reviews.author: movieman413

customer_reviews.title: I purchased it because i had a wedding to shoot ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it because i had a wedding to shoot in 4 days. Giving it 5 stars because it really saved the wedding and my life.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product a the right price. Works great with heavy DSLR with 500 zoom lens.

customer_reviews.title: Excuse me while I whip this out
customer_reviews.text: It is very heavy duty. Professional is spot on with the description

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: I can not see how this thing has so many 5 stars. It is garbage. Go get a good tri-pod and then a good mono-pod. Dont buy
customer_reviews.author: Proud Model Train N ScalerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience. Even if I followed the directions complete ...
customer_reviews.text: leg arrived broken. after sorting through everything I found a little note saying caution please follow these procedures to unfold tripod legs. The caution note was almost hidden. Bad experience. Even if I followed the directions complete it showed me the legs are very week thin sort of diecast metal.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Webb

customer_reviews.title: Tripod Piece Broken
customer_reviews.text: The product is poorly made. The tripod leg arrived Broken. This is my third time trying to leave a review. I'm heading to social media next if they won't post this.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Rollie

customer_reviews.title: Great monopod design...Useful and 'How did I manage without it" product.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy 'Tripod'...more of a monopod with feet. Solid steel construction with quality threaded-screw-type locking discs for each extension part of the shaft. Sturdy, takes up less floor space than the conventional tripod...does not rep[lace it, but substitutes superbly and hands-free. I am extremely satisfied with the Pan-head design and its flexibility of use. I have prepared a video of this piece of equipment along with two other pieces of DIGIANT camera equipment I purchased from the E&J Group Co. Ltd that are fantastic buys. Vie video of three product I bought and enjoy, at:
customer_reviews.author: Arthur B. Friday

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value and price point and it works just fine!

product_meta.title: DIGIANT MP-3606 Professional Video Monopod 70" Aluminum Telescopic DSLR Camera Monopod with Fluid Head and Tripod Base, Include Carrying Bag, Black
product_meta.description:
DIGIANT 2-in-1 Camera Monopod with Removable Tripod Base
Specifications:
Color: Black
Max Extended Height: 70 inches
Min Folded Height: 29 inches
Extended Sections: 4 parts 
Tripod Weight: 4 lbs
Max load: 5kg/11lbs

Features:
★3-way Pan Head: Pan head with knob, helps 360 degree shoot with minimum effort, give you the angle you want.
★Monopod Tripod Combo: Three 9.4” Feet provide stability, remove the tripod base, then here is a monopod. 
★1/4"-20 & 3/8"-16 Reversible Screws: you can mount any camera up to 11 lbs on the mounting plate.
★4-section locks: Give you 29”-70” Monopod Height Range, good for outdoor/indoor use.
★Rotary Monopod: the whole monopod can rotate 360 degree on the tripod base when you release the blue part like the way in the first item picture.

Package includes:
2-in-1 Camera Monopod x 1
Carrying Bag x1
Instruction x 1
feature_bullets: Professional Video Head: 3-Way Pan Head with Quick Release Plate and Built-in Bubble View Levels pivots up to 180 degrees; 1/4"-20 & 3/8"-16 screws on the mounting plate,suitable for all SLR, DSLR, Video Cameras plus Camcorders up to 5kg /11 lbs
Compact Video Fluid Monopod: Quick Twist Lock Reliably Secures & Ensures Super-fast Set up with Rapid Rotation Movements, Great Operating Height 74-179cm /29"-70" for Overhead Shooting
Camera Monopod with Feet : Swivel the Monopod 360°and Tilt 15°in any direction thanks to Ball Joint of Tripod Stand Base, Extra Stable with 23.8cm /9.4" Retractable Feet
Ideal Travel Monopod Tripod Combo: Wrist strap and Foam Hand Grip for comfortable hold, Carrying bag included
Heavy Duty DSLR Monopod for Cameras: Carrying Bag Included | Tilt: -75° to +90° | Pan: 360° | Height: 74cm to 179cm| Max Load: 5kg /11 lbs| 2-year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars131 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
